issue.title: [C++] Rename libarrow_gpu to libarrow_cuda
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3209](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3209). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I'm proposing to rename this library since we could conceivably have OpenCL bindings in the repository also

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3209?focusedCommentId=16609695) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Yes, I think that's a good idea.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3209?focusedCommentId=16624062) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I'm pushing this off to 0.12 since we aren't packaging this yet, and the change will require some work on updating the Linux package names

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3209?focusedCommentId=16708890) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Should we also rename the "arrow/gpu" directory and the `arrow::gpu` namespace?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3209?focusedCommentId=16708897) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
We should change the namespace; I'm not sure that changing the directory name is necessary as long as it's clear what files inside are cuda-related

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3209?focusedCommentId=16710935) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 3088
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3088>
